description.narrative: The capacity of government and key stakeholders to plan, budget and provide access to inclusive, integrated, resilient and quality basic social services is strengthened

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

mailing-address.narrative: 31st Floor Yuchengco Tower Rizal Commercial Banking Corporation (RCBC) Plaza 6819 Ayala Avenue corner Gil Puyat Avenue Makati City

sector.narrative: Building global / regional / national stakeholder evaluation capacity

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Disaster risk reduction (including linkage to climate change)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)
Technical assistance - Children in urban settings

related-activity.ref: 3420/A0/06/004 SOCIAL POLICY AND GOVERNANCE FOR CHILD RIGHTS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The capacity of government and key stakeholders to plan, budget and provide access to inclusive, integrated, resilient and quality basic social services is strengthened

description.narrative: UNICEF provided timely and relevant support to improved national government capacity to report on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG), child and youth participation in local governance, child-centred disaster risk reduction and policy/programme evaluation. UNICEF also sustained support for Government to adopt a scaled-up mechanism to measure and advocate for child-friendly local governance at sub-national level | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Local governments with development plans that include priorities to improve access and quality of basic social services

target.value: 2023:3 provinces, 3 cities reflect priorities that improve access and quality of basic social services for children in the CDP/PDPFP

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning mechanisms for child/adolescent and/or community participation in local planning, budgeting and monitoring processes

actual.value:
2019:UNICEF supported the development of the Revised CFLGA which includes a specific indicator on children participation in local governance. The policy was approved this year, 28 August 2019. (DILG- DSWD-DOH-DEpEd JMC 2019-01)
The 3-year Rolling Workplan with 3 provinces and 3 cities include capacity b

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) that produce disaggregated child data

actual.value:
2019:UNICEF supported the development of the policy Revised CFLGA with specific indicator on establishment of disaggregated database and utilization of data for children. The policy was approved this year, 28 August 2019. (DILG- DSWD-DOH-DEpEd JMC 2019-01)
Discussion on the capacity building and provisi

title.narrative: Local government (incl. municipalities) with budget allocated to child priorities

actual.value:
2019:UNICEF supported the development of the policy Revised CFLGA with specific indicator that will assess the budget allocated for children priorities by the LGUs. The policy was approved this year, 28 August 2019. (DILG- DSWD-DOH-DEpEd JMC 2019-01)

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

baseline.value: Level 1 with 1 study conducted on PFM

target.value: 2022:Level 2: Generated evidence to support budget allocation/expenditure but advocacy has not yet demonstrated improved budget allocation/expenditure

actual.value:
2019:Study on the assessment of the Special Education Fund yet to commence next year (Q1-Q2). The assessment is proposed to be part of the workplan to be developed with the Department of Finance (DOF).
The Public Expenditure Review of Social Protection will commence in 2020. As agreed with NEDA, the T

title.narrative: Contribution to a policy change that protects child rights and advances the needs of the most vulnerable children during COVID-19 (Yes/No) [COVID].
Existence of Child sensitive national or local risk management plans addressing risks related to disasters, climate change, conflict, public health emergencies or other crises

target.value: 2023:3 provincial LDRRMP, 3 City LDRRMP, and 2 National risk management plans (NDRRMP and NCCAP) are developed that reflect child-sensitive priorities
